skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation in SKILL.md. All 99 static findings are false positives caused by the scanner misinterpreting markdown documentation examples as executable code. The skill is purely instructional guidance for creating AI skills with no executable code, network calls, file system modifications, or environment variable access.

content.user_title: Create Effective AI Skills with Proven Design Patterns
content.value_statement: Building AI skills requires careful planning and structured design to work effectively. This guide provides proven patterns for creating skills that extend Claude's capabilities while managing context efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Provides step-by-step skill creation workflow from understanding to packaging
Explains progressive disclosure design patterns for context efficiency
Offers guidance on organizing scripts, references, and assets
Details YAML frontmatter requirements for skill triggering
Explains when to use scripts versus references versus assets
limitations: Requires manual implementation of skill contents
Limited to guidance and best practices

use_cases.title: Design custom AI skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills for specific domains or workflows that extend Claude's capabilities.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill development
use_cases.description: Establish consistent patterns for creating skills that integrate with company systems.

use_cases.title: Publish high-quality skills
use_cases.description: Follow proven design patterns to create efficient, well-structured skills for distribution.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill for [specific task]. Guide me through the skill creation process step by step.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize existing skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a skill that [current functionality]. How can I optimize its structure using progressive disclosure principles?

prompt_templates.title: Choose resource types
prompt_templates.prompt: For a skill that [skill purpose], should I use scripts, references, or assets? What's the best approach?

prompt_templates.title: Manage large content
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill documentation is getting very long. How can I split it effectively while maintaining discoverability?

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for processing PDF documents
output: Step 1: Understand - Ask about specific PDF tasks (merge, split, extract text)
Step 2: Plan - Identify need for scripts/pdf_processor.py and references/docs.md
Step 4: Edit - Create Python script for PDF operations, add documentation
Step 5: Package - Validate and create .skill file for distribution

output_examples.input: How do I organize a skill that needs to support AWS, GCP, and Azure?
output: Keep SKILL.md lean with provider selection guidance
Create separate reference files: aws.md, gcp.md, azure.md
Each reference file contains provider-specific patterns
Claude loads only the relevant reference when user selects provider

output_examples.input: My SKILL.md is over 1000 lines. What should I do?
output: Split content into separate reference files by topic
Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines for efficiency
Include table of contents in each reference file
Use grep patterns to help Claude find relevant sections

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines to minimize context usage
Use progressive disclosure - only load information when needed
Include clear trigger phrases in the description field
Test all scripts before packaging the skill
anti_patterns: Duplicating information between SKILL.md and reference files
Creating auxiliary documentation files like README or INSTALL guides
Including unnecessary context about the skill creation process itself
Exceeding context window limits with overly verbose instructions

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, the design principles work across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code implementations.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should stay under 500 lines. Reference files can be larger but need tables of contents.

faq.question: Can I include executable code in skills?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts in the scripts/ directory can be executed when needed without loading into context.

faq.question: How do I ensure my skill triggers correctly?
faq.answer: Write clear descriptions in YAML frontmatter that include what the skill does and when to use it.

faq.question: What if my skill needs multiple frameworks?
faq.answer: Organize by framework in separate reference files and link from SKILL.md based on user selection.

faq.question: How do I handle large documentation sets?
faq.answer: Split into focused reference files by domain, and include grep patterns in SKILL.md for searching.
